üì¢ üá¨üáß Recent Ofcom report emphasises shift in attitudes of UK public towards sex & violence on TV ‚ñ∂ In a nutshell: people feel the level of sex & violence on TV has increased & intensified (more graphic & realistic portrayal) yet the audiences tend to underline the positive role played by TV in countering the potential negative impact of such content (less stereotyping, emphasis on consent, more positive role models etc.) üí° Through the continuing analysis of the audiences' perception and attitudes, Ofcom intends to - help broadcasters better understand audience's expectations and how to protect them - take into account viewers' perspective in its decision-making process and to inform future regulation.

People have a gift for making sex complicated. Technology and cultural change have made it much easier to do so. The number of patients involved in pornography has dramatically increased. Are we prepared to provide them with quality therapy? Can we work with couples in conflict about porn without taking sides? Infidelity is easier than ever‚Äîwhile its definitions become ever murkier. Webcams? Secretive texting? Dating profiles? ‚ÄúEmotional affairs?‚Äù It can be hard to interpret the meaning of unauthorized but ambiguous behaviors. See Details: https://lnkd.in/eMshhGPg #telehealth #telemedicine #CME
